website_summaries.verdict: Strong brand name. Classic stainless steel construction is both functional and decorative. It looks like a vintage percolator, but it has modern improvements.
pros: The retro-style pot can travel from kitchen to tabletop
The brew strength can be accurately gauged through the lid
Pours coffee easily due to ventilation holes
cons: Shorter power cord could be problematic for table service

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 whole days.
customer_reviews.text: Our perc burned out after 3 days. Contact Hamilton Beach & they said email copy of shipping receipt. We didn't have shipping receipt as our autistic daughter opened the package & threw out receipt. Guess were out purchase price. It seems like HB could simply track our order through Amazon. We're through with Hamilton Beach. We are switching to Euro style appliances. We realize they are all made in China but style matters. The perc was to replace a 6yo Krupps that still worked. We are using it again now.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Dali Lama

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a great coffee pot for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great coffee pot for the money. The only thing that prevents it from getting a 5 star rating is that there is a persistent smell of hot plastic that comes from the base of the coffee pot. It does need to sit on a pot holder to prevent burning of a table. The plastic in no way seems to be melting, or in anyway does it appear to cause damage, but the smell is annoying. Other than that, ours regularly makes 1-2 pots of coffee a day and stays on for about 4-5 hours a day with no other problems noted.
customer_reviews.author: shinshidoshi

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: For the past couple of years I have had to drink decaf coffee, which was made in my Mr. Coffee coffee maker. It was good but, oh my, perked coffee is undeniably the best ever. I am so glad I purchased this Hamilton Beach percolator. It not only makes great coffee now I don't have the large coffee maker taking up counter space. Instead, I have my percolator, which looks beautiful. I personally, do not have any problems cleaning it or setting it up to brew. What really surprised me, is how quick it prepares the coffee. It keeps the coffee hot for quite some time, I finish the pot before it gets cold anyway.
customer_reviews.author: cha292929

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine while it worked
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine while it worked, but it only lasted about 1 year and 5 months. Then it would light up and make a bit of noise, but wouldn't get hot enough to actually make coffee. We didn't submerge it or do anything out of the ordinary to it. Maybe we just got a lemon. Since it was just over the 1 year warranty, no return available. Contacted Hamilton Beach and they offered me a 50% off coupon good for 30 days, but I don't really want to buy another piece of junk at 1/2 price.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Miron

customer_reviews.title: New perker!
customer_reviews.text: I love the perker! I also bought the Kona coffee beans ,we fresh grind them one day at a time. You don't need a paper filter just use coarse ground, it sits firmly. Coffee nice and hot. This is the new version of the same brand of coffee pot we've been using the vintage chrome one from the 70s I think. You'll love this pot for the price, it's really cute matching my black and chrome appliances. The big glass top provides entertainment while inhaling those coffee beans' heavenly perfume.
customer_reviews.author: Fenton

customer_reviews.title: It's OK....
customer_reviews.text: Rating change ; Element failed, no replaceable parts. Company would not replace the coffee maker as expected. The smell of over-heated Bakelite plastic encasing the element is overwhelming while brewing. What is Bakelite? Baekelite) or polyoxybenzylmethylenglycolanhydride was the first plastic made from synthetic components. It is a thermosetting phenol formaldehyde resin, formed from a condensation reaction of phenol with formaldehyde. This Bakelite will permeate the room however is not in contact with the water. We live in a throwaway society so buying a coffee maker every year might be the norm. Update - Element failed after a year. No replacement parts available.
customer_reviews.author: Vakmere

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hot cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Easiest coffee pot to use. Just plug it in & it percolates. It is fast & stays HOT until you unplug it. Used a smart plug with Alexa & scheduled it for weekdays. On the weekend I tell Alexa ‘coffee on’ when I wake up & it’s ready when I get downstairs. As for the coffee-nothing beats a percolator. Love the sleek mod design of this pot. I chose this pot because every other Hamilton beach appliance I had lasted forever.
customer_reviews.author: MnMs

customer_reviews.title: Best Percolater
customer_reviews.text: We use this guy daily. I use PBW cleaner that I used for cleaning my beer brewing equipment to clean and it can't be easier.. fill with warm water, add a teaspoon of PBW, let sit for a few hours, rinse.. just like new again. This thing brews a really good tasting cup of coffee.. you can also unplug, let cool and double brew.. it keeps the coffee warm and often lasts into the next day before brew a new batch. Even daily cleans are easy with just a bottle scrubby and scotch pad/sponge... takes minutes to clean and use.. We even bought one of these for my wife's parents. They love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Strong hot coffee and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Update: After two weeks of use the ready light popped and shattered. I am waiting for a response from the seller to return. I will write a new review after I hear it they are going to fix this problem. I'm writing a review because of all the bad reviews this product got. I completely disagree with them. It make a flavorful strong cup of hot coffee. It is also very pretty. I bought a different percolator because of the bad reviews on this one. I had to return the other one that received good reviews because it leaked the first time I used it. I'm glad it did because I love this one!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Deign Flaw, Can Burn You, Be Careful!
customer_reviews.text: When this is less than half full and you have to hold it up at a higher angle to pour it into the cup, it pours a bit slow but then will suddenly release a large amount of the HOT coffee, and since you were holding the cup close to the spout, the sudden higher pressure rush of coffee will over shoot the cup and hit your hand if your holding a cup without holding only the handle. It was hard to explain this so if you have a question, ask. Just know that if it's half empty of hot coffee, set your cup on the counter to pour it in case it suddenly overshoots the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Not loving it
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to having percolator coffee again and not that keurig instant coffee farce. This worked great for the first two weeks or so. Now I have to remake my coffee 2 and sometimes 3 times over because for some reason it comes out looking like dirty dish water. Not sure why but I know I'm not the only one that this has happened to. I just made my coffee for the second time and it's clear light brown water. Throwing it right in the trash. Tired of this
customer_reviews.author: KatieDec25

customer_reviews.title: Average coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and construction. I like hotter coffee than what a drip maker produces and this fills that need perfectly. Good, hot, brews quickly and stays warm for the hour I need it to before leaving for my day. Only flaw I see is the lid is not very tight even in the "locked" position, but no leakage due to that. Cannot comment on durability other than to say decent quality stainless steel, and only used a few times so how well it will last is unknown. Edit 6-30-2019: Purchased October 19, 2018, blue perking indicator light works, green ready light burned out. Still brews good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: DTL

customer_reviews.title: Not a good brew
customer_reviews.text: I bought this percolator to replace a Cuisinart whose lid kept breaking. This one has a solid lid that works great except that it doesn't lock on as it is supposed to. So that last cup of coffee that you pour may have the lid in the cup also. I haven't been able to brew a decent cup of coffee with it. I've tried more coffee and less coffee. It's either weak or tastes scorched. The cord socket is directly below the handle which makes it difficult for me to plug in. I actually have to tilt the appliance to plug in the cord; sometimes spilling water from the spout doing so.
customer_reviews.author: woodbug1950

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the coffee for hours at just the right temperature
customer_reviews.text: Makes the coffee quickly as many other reviews have said. I used to burn the coffee after an hour or so with a drip maker. This keeps the coffee at the perfect temperature for hours! I use a strainer to pour the coffee into the cup as I always have some grounds coming out. There is a blue light that comes on when you plug it in and it turns green when the coffee is ready. My green light burned out after 3 months is why only 4 stars. But the percolator works without the green light so I'm still happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I M O does not last long and it's not cheap!. I ordered on March 3rd and loved it. then it quit working, so I got a replacement April 19th. this morning trying to make my coffee before going to church. it wouldn't work so I try to return it for a refund and it was just pass the return date of May 31. I'm not a happy camper, I'm waiting to hear from Hamilton beach, After online chat with Amazon. Mlw. Update... amazon called me they were unable to reach Hamilton beach... amazon says they will refund upon receipt of percolator mlw
customer_reviews.author: Mary W.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of peculated coffee......BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: Like all the rest of these electric coffee percolators, they work great but don't last long. This is my third one, different manufacturers, but they all have the same components in them. This one lasted 1 year and 3 months with every day use. I would be willing to pay twice the price for one made with components that last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Nick V

customer_reviews.title: Sparked and popped
customer_reviews.text: liked the percolator. Received my unit June 29th and couldn't wait to make my first cup of coffee. Love the smell and taste of perked coffee. Was happy with the unit until today,nearly 1 month later. Went to plug it in and it popped and sparked and died. My percolator had an early death. Not too happy. Contacted customer service at Amazon and was immediately taken care of. I received my new percolator the next day and will enjoy my cup of coffee in the morning. Thank you Amazon.. You are the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Dolman

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love the taste of percolated coffee, and this pot makes a great, fast cup. However, I prefer the filter baskets on vintage models because the holes are smaller. With this pot, you must use a coarse ground bean and paper filter to avoid grounds in your pot. There are a number of parts to clean after each use which is typical, and the lid feels like it could easily break. It’s doesn’t seat very securely and isn’t super solid in construction. Overall, a good option considering the limited choices on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: This percolator works well BUT the problem is it just doesn’t make a great tasting cup of coffee. My previous one did. I use the same coffee, water, etc. and this one just doesn’t taste anywhere close. I have to say I’m really disappointed. The electronics in the bottom of this pot also make an unpleasant smell when brewing, kind of like hot wiring. Wish I had ordered the exact one I had before but bought this one because it was less expensive. If I still had the box, I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: JJJ

customer_reviews.title: Try Another Brand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one percolator on Ordered on June 23, 2018. It was wonderful. I purchased a second percolator on Ordered on January 30, 2019, I was wonderful. I purchased to have two because between my husband and myself, one pot is not enough. Just this past week, March 17th thru to now, both of them are having to be ran twice. I run once, have only hot water. I have to run a second time and then I have coffee. They are both clean. There is no reason I should be having this issue with either of them. I am going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Cherryl

customer_reviews.title: Insurance
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product in the hopes of getting good perked coffee again. It worked long enough for us to get the right percentage of coffee to water for the perfect cup (a couple of weeks) and then it just quit. We tried it in different outlets 9it had been plugged into one that had a surge proctector. Since we had a Square Trade 4 year protection on it, we turned in a claim. It has been well within the time allowed by Amazon and we have heard nothing from the claim.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but do not buy this on the pretense that the plug is different from the old 2 post plug for the pot itself, because it is not. I would imagine a lot of people have had trouble with the old type of plug and this new type of plug is the only reason I paid the extra money for it. If you can find the 3 prong plug for the pot like it shows, you can use old computers or monitor cords because they have that extra reach, but not here. (picture included of what I received)
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this because 1) the name brand and 2) the 2-4 Cup Faberware pot was too small. The Faberware made EXCELLENT coffee and I loved it. But it only makes 2 Mugs of coffee. The Hamilton is heavy, bundlesome, leaves coffee grounds everywhere inside the pot even with 2 filters. Very Disappointed in this Percolater! I will buy the larger Faberware pot even tho it’s quiet expensive. Don’t buy Hamilton Beach!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pegi Walker

customer_reviews.title: then you'll love this. Beyond the annoyance of all the cleaning
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason that technology marched on...if you want the retro "fun" of dissembling the pot and cleaning it's 5 separate pieces, yes 5, then you'll love this. Beyond the annoyance of all the cleaning, frankly the coffee is just not that good. It totally lacks the depth and richness of a good brew. Make it stronger you may think. I did too, but that just made a bigger mess and didn't improve the flavor at all. My grandma loved her old percolator, but that's just because she never had a modern machine.
customer_reviews.author: Teach435

customer_reviews.title: Not a good percolator if you like strong coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this coffee pot. it has a short brew time which does not allow for a good cup of coffee. the coffee is very weak and after checking the basket the grounds are still dry. I have tried several different cup levels and added additional coffee grounds with no success. I have had to re-pour the coffee through the basket to get a decent cup of coffee. After a dozen attempts to get this thing to work, I've given up. Also it continues to smell like burning electrical components even after multiple uses. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Perna

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love this new coffee percolator.
customer_reviews.text: Don't knock it until you try it. Yes it is a throw back to years gone by but our more sophisticated programmable coffee maker can't measure up to this device. First the coffee is piping hot. Second the coffee is actually percolated over the grounds many times over which produces a richer cup of coffee. We won't ever go back. We're so glad we bought it. Also, we opted for the 12 cup version and are glad we did. Seems we drink every drop between the two of us every day. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love this percolator! Not only does the water/coffee never touch plastic - but the coffee is perfect! Have had it for a week now - and every morning I comment on the Best Coffee Ever! Another plus is that is makes the coffee much faster than my old drop coffee maker! It's nice looking and doesn't take up much space at all! I bought the filters that were suggested - but have not used them yet - have not had any grounds in the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Designed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this percolator after my Farberware percolator died after 25 years of use. This percolator has a design flaw that pushes the coffee grounds out the top of the basket. I experimented with paper filter discs on the top and bottom of the grounds without much success. Lately I have been using a small strainer when pouring into a cup. I cannot recommend this product and will buy a replacement soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Save money, and make excellent coffee at home
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing like percolated coffee. This pot is great. It makes wonderful coffee, and is easy to clean. Anything with a hose like drip makers concern me because of bacteria. Keurigs have water that sits in the tank😮 This is a clean, easy way to have the best cup of coffee you can make at home. My only negative is the water level indicator. Because of its placement, it never gets a chance to dry out. It is also impossible to get into it to clean it. The pluses greatly outweigh this one little negative.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: GOOD hot cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is my second percolator in 16 months. The first one was a different brand (and cheaper). I am VERY pleased with our newest Hamilton Beach coffee maker. It is a little heavier and provides a good HOT cup of coffee. I love watching the coffee through the lid. The ONLY “ugh” is that the coffee basket is narrow but that isn’t a big issue
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Believe the reviews on this one
customer_reviews.text: Bought on Dec 3, Broke on Dec 20 I suspect heating core broke. I would open it and check but I do not have a triangle tip screwdriver. Great coffee while it lasted. Update: 5 stars! Amazon sent me another pot, and it is brewing the best coffee ever!!! No issues, No problems!!! I wasted too much time and money on drip coffee pots. This is right up there with my French press, but much more convenient!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Mc

customer_reviews.title: Tasty coffee
customer_reviews.text: If you've used an electric percolator, you know the pros (stronger coffee, fast brew, easy to use) and the cons (grounds at the bottom). The only caveat here is that the heating element gives off a faint smell, when the pot is new. It is not inside the pot, and doesn't adversely affect the flavor. I've had this pot for a few weeks, and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Fonebone

customer_reviews.title: It's a simple to use coffee percolator.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this percolator for 3 weeks now and it hasn't let me down yet. It makes a hot, rich, full flavor pot of coffee every time. I also like the nostalgic look. I do use paper filters in the basket because it's hard to find coarse ground coffee anymore, not the pot's fault. Pretty much simple to use once you figure out the right amount of coffee grounds to how many cups of water your making. I just fill it to the 12 cup line and add 4 scoops of grounds and it comes out perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Pa.

customer_reviews.title: Great pot for the $
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get why the bad reviews?? The dome is definitely glass! It makes coffee fast!! And tasty, I replaced shorter cord with longer one from amazon. It has a satin finish, no show fingerprints! If you get grounds in ur coffee u probably didn’t let ur coffee grounds drip dry and they came thru the top of the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Yoleo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Finish
customer_reviews.text: Works properly like a good percolator should. I have my doubts on how long this one will last. I've tried many brands and only seem to get a few years out of them before they die. What I wouldn't give to get one of those old West Bend Poly-Perks from the 60s-70s. They lasted forever for $8.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Tim

customer_reviews.title: we tried several and have been happy with this
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine percolator, we've always preferred percolated coffee, but gave in and bought a basket type. Found it took too much room on counter, coffee wasn't hot. Sent it back, ordered this one, very happy, it's lightweight, the pouring is easy and doesn't spill and the coffee is pretty hot. Always hard to find the filters for this type of coffee maker, but that's true of them all. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: marion  reed

customer_reviews.title: Great percolator!
customer_reviews.text: Love this percolator! The coffee tastes better than in my old drip maker, even with tap water. Very easy to use and clean. Brews just as quickly as the drip. Keeps the coffee nice and hot without resulting in that burnt flavor. Saves space on my counter too! I also use traditional drip coffee filter. I just tear a little hole in the middle and form around the coffee basket. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: WickedStacey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the it but I am not sure I would buy again. It is not labeled what grade stainless steel and does not seem well made. It is annoying to have coffee grounds almost daily. It does brew fast, keeps coffee warm while plugged in. It does not work as well as the older models (from years ago).
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: It gets H O T
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker overall is easy to use. The coffee is great and it keeps it hot, as it should. Warning though, the pot gets REALLY hot. You have to be extremely cautious around it when it’s hot and would not recommend for people with small children....it’s a great coffee maker but it’s also hot metal.. other than that I’d say it’s pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted a month.
customer_reviews.text: When the package arrived the lid for it was the wrong one and the coffee grounds canister was too tall. It would get stuck and we would need tools to remove it. Luckily I kept all working pieces from my older percolator which was the same model. This one was much louder than my older one but after a few days I was used to it. Just now its broken on me. I've tried my old power cable but its the same result. Barely lasted a month!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes good, but you must pour slowly to prevent grounds ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have heeded prior reviews. Have not been able to brew a full pot without the grounds rising up in the basket and flowing over the sides. I have tried every sort of filter with no success of stopping this action. Using NO filter does not curb its ability to flood the coffee pot with grounds. I remove the basket before pouring. Coffee tastes good, but you must pour slowly to prevent grounds in cup and can't drink the last 6 or 8 ounces unless you want to chew the grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in NC

customer_reviews.title: Very good pot and the best coffee you will ever have!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pot after getting tired of my keurig clogging and giving trickling cups of boring coffee. You will use less coffee and have a hot old fashioned cup of coffee with the pot. I like the electric part and that it is easy to clean and I can see the coffee percolating with the glass top. The pot keeps coffee hot all day or as long as you want. You do have to unplug the pot as it does not have auto shutoff setting. I like it and it is a great price!
customer_reviews.author: MyHonestReviews

customer_reviews.title: Look for another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker July 30, 2018 because I have another one from HB that I have had for 6 years, still working. This coffee pot stopped working first week of April. 9 months of use. Great while it worked. Contacted company and was given the run around and they were not helpful at all. Polite but nothing was taken care of. I was disappointed because I did expect consistent quality like my previous coffee pot. I will definitely go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tess M.

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Ok wanted to add that ALTHOUGH I have had bad luck with this coffee maker WHEN it works we love it. I am on my THIRD from Hamilton Beach. (must say they have stood behind it) I'm not certain but think its the thermostat on this thing that doesn't work very long. Maybe they make them to only last a year, but thus far a couple months then it starts shutting off before the coffee gets brewed. Hoping this third one is a charm!
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well. Smells of hot plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I was terribly dissapointed in this coffee pot. I was replacing a Hamilton Beach electric percolator and liked the additional features this one offered. The sight glass and the glad perk top were certainly not worth what I got. On the first brew, the smell of hot plastic filled my house. After a couple of days, the little led ready light quit working. After that, the "gentle warming" feature was doing a job of keeping the coffee just a tick below boiling causing poor flavor. At this point, the blue brew light May or may not light and the green ready light doesn't come on at all. If the pot is on, the house smells of plastic. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these that I bought at Walmart in 2014. LOVED IT. it finally gave out, and now I have this one. very cheaply made compared to my old one.....the pot feels much lighter, so it is either really thin steel or more aluminum added. THe filter basket is a different size, too, and it is aluminum. Wish I had kept my old one. It works, but now my coffee has a weird smell, not a coffee smell. I will not buy this item again. if it was just like my old one, I'd be happy as a clam. but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: c me

customer_reviews.title: Was a letdown...a total waste!
customer_reviews.text: Worked once and died! Hamilton Beach replaced with a brand new one which have been working for two weeks cross my fingers that continues to work! Okay, second one worked for 2 weeks and died. Dont wasre your money. Looks nice but shotty price of crap! Pots now used to water plants!
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Coffee pot gets very hot.Hot enough to burn you.
customer_reviews.text: The ENTIRE pot gets very hot. And the lid will not 'lock on". Other than these safety issues...it works.And that old time percolator sound is nice.And the coffee smell in the kitchen is nice.Just be very careful...as I worte...this thing gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: R A Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Equipment Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: This product is giving off a weird smell, crackling, & popping like a space rocket is about to lift off after very little use. I bought it in October for a get together, put it away & just took it out to use for quarantine & after making coffee a second time, the sounds coming out were on the level of malfunction & explode. After washing it, I noticed a brown ring had formed on the stainless steel. Percolators are like mini pressure cookers, but I've never heard of a fatality due to the use of one & don't want to be the first. I hope returning it is possible & covered by a manufacturer warranty🤞
customer_reviews.author: Lea A.

customer_reviews.title: Love my percolator
customer_reviews.text: I love my percolator, I switched from a Mr. coffee. I always had Luke warm coffee but with this percolator my coffee is hot!! Just like the coffee at McDonald's. I swear it even taste better. Works perfect. Easy to use, and takes up less space on the counter. I guess the only draw back would be its not immerseable. I really haven't had any issues with washing it out tho. Thanks percolator.
customer_reviews.author: erin langer

customer_reviews.title: We love this pot
customer_reviews.text: We love this pot. Have owned several and always replace with the same thing. For the money, it's a good pot, best we have found. Course in today's disposable goods these don't last forever, but we get several years of use from each one.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Pickens Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: even more so I have to go to the trouble if repackaging it and returning it - even bought the guarantee on this which is maybe a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the reviews and on Day 2 went to make a pot and it didn’t work - very disappointing; even more so I have to go to the trouble if repackaging it and returning it - even bought the guarantee on this which is maybe a good thing
customer_reviews.author: Echo Co

customer_reviews.title: Twelve Cups of Coffee in Twelve Minutes
customer_reviews.text: We've been using a single cup "pod" coffee machine for a few years, along with a reusable metal screen filter. For those times when we want to make multiple servings at once, we purchased this percolator. This HB percolator is very solid feeling, and the glass top is a nice touch. Filling it with cold water, the full twelve cups is ready in twelve minutes. The coffee tastes great. The hole is large enough that I can put my entire hand inside for a good cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schey

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a month for the second time
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this for my mom in December, it lasted 1 month. It did not want to turn on at all. I had it replaced in late January, and it broke again. It will not turn on. Since they replaced it once, I can't get it replaced again. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better that percolator coffee
customer_reviews.text: Well made and cleans well. My second percolator (first was a retail purchase from a Big Box store). This one is well made and interestly it hasn't "crudded" up as quickly as the first (different brand). I guess you get what you pay for.....
customer_reviews.author: HCaprio

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker on the Market!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always thought percolators made the best coffee. When my 25 year old percolator finally quit I decided to try this HB model. It is, by far, the best coffee maker I have ever owned. It gently brews at a perfect temperature, making delicious coffee without any bitterness. I used to use mineral drops to cut the bitterness, but not now. Now I have smooth, rich, black coffee. Great job Hamilton Beach!!!
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We use this early daily! Used to replace our keurig (cleaned many times and stayed super watery) and wouldn't go back! Super easy to use, clean and produces very strong coffee. The indicator light tells you when it's ready. The removable plug ended up being a bonus when we have guests in, so it can be placed on the table. Used with perk or standard coffee, with and without a filter and it all is fine. We have filled up to max and a few spare coffee grounds, but does well.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: my 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these last year and for some reason the heating element broke. I would be angry that it only lasted a year but that was a year of three times a day constant use and abuse so I am more than satisfied. I had to buy another simply because this is the one that works the fastest and the only one that makes my coffee the way I like it, strong and scalding.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn DeShay

customer_reviews.title: Should work for more than 5 month / dealing with warranty was a joke and costs$
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working correctly after only 5 months. Made weak coffee, or sometimes nothing at all. Then, Hammilton Beach warranty dept. I guess it was made us call, wast time on the phone - and jump through hoops - and charged more than $10 to get a replacement. NEVER AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Going

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised and printed on the box as a stainless steel percolator. False advertising! Only the insert is stainless steel. It should be correctly listed as "12 cup percolator with stainless basket". The consumer is terribly mislead!
customer_reviews.author: Sage10

customer_reviews.title: 12 Cups in 12 Minutes :)
customer_reviews.text: 12 Delicious HOT and strong cups in just 12 minutes. Exactly what I'd hoped for..!! More grounds in the coffee than I expected with regular already ground coffee. Wait for about three minutes after brewing for the grounds to settle to the bottom of the pot, if you use regular coffee. If you grind your own beans - select coarse grind, problem solved. You can drink your coffee right away, without any grounds floating in your cup.
customer_reviews.author: Ise Loa

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee, but....
customer_reviews.text: I love this percolator, but the amount of coffee grounds every time is horrible. I use a filter inside the basket & I grind my beans on the highest setting for coarse. Unless someone has a tip about the grounds, that's the only negative I have for this percolator
customer_reviews.author: Catfather

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful electric percolator
customer_reviews.text: Love the looks of this stainless steel percolator. I had forgotten how much better coffee tastes from an electric percolator as opposed to a coffee maker. The coffee gets hotter and stays hot until you unplug it. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Zachariasen

customer_reviews.title: Makes a far better cup of coffee than drip machines
customer_reviews.text: Okay, Mr. Coffee-type drip machines are fine. But I made the mistake of purchasing a percolator for camping. That spoiled me for really, tasty coffee. I had to have one for home. I wanted an electric so I didn't have to watch it on the stove every second. I also wanted one that was stainless steel and had a glass bubble to see it perk. I use this on the weekends when I can make real, percolated coffee. It tastes so much better. I really love this percolator and would recommend it to anyone who truly enjoys their coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Marking

customer_reviews.title: This is not a real percolator
customer_reviews.text: A real percolator puts the water through the grounds over and over again. This thing is finished so fast it's just a percolater shaped drip coffee maker. No improvement in taste over a cheat Mr. Coffee style drippolator.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Doolan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second perculator. The first lasted for years. I bought this one because my old one was about to fail. I placed this unit in service in mid march and it failed four months later. Electric short in base unit. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Old Fashioned Coffee Pot
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the style of this old fashioned coffee maker (as opposed to the paper filter drip ones) as you don't need to bother buying filters forever. There is one thing though. Over time the coffee maker may seem to quit working and it probably is the electrical cord that fails as opposed to the inside heating element. So I suggest purchasing a spare cord ($4-$8) and having one on hand or you will never know why your perfectly adequate coffee pot stopped working just because the cord quit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F Ware

customer_reviews.title: done with the Keurig hype. Back to Old School in coffee brewing.
customer_reviews.text: We have officially booted the Keurig out of our home. I call it coffee flavored water. We have gone back to the way my Mom made it, in a peculator! WOW! Better than the drip, too. The beautiful dark carmel color throughout as you pour it in your cup. Amazingly good! Such a difference. Keurig = ..25 - 35 cents per watered down coffee per cup. Percultor= .06 cup. This pot, just put in the filter, toss some coffee on top, plug it in and then go take the dogs for a walk. Come back and pour yourself a great cup of coffee. Love that it turns itself off after brewing. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Scubadoo

customer_reviews.title: Smells like grandma’s house in the morning !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift . I have one myself and I really enjoy it . It makes tasty coffee and it’s nice to see the coffee perculating ! It reminds me of my grandmother’s house in the morning . Once you use this to make coffee , you won’t look at another drip coffee maker !
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Numbers are easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Perks coffee fast and keeps it hot. Very well balanced and numbers are easy to read inside and out. Does not have any automatic features other than the light changes from blue when it’s perking to green when it’s done perking
customer_reviews.author: L. Yeash

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee in forever
customer_reviews.text: Having used a drip type coffee maker for better than 40 years I forgot just how much taste and aroma we gave up by switching just for the sake of saving a few minutes. I am more than pleased with this choice and never plan to go back to an inferior way to brew coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jay T

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, there is no paper filter!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. We love that there is no filter required. So many percolators leave so many coffee grounds at the bottom of the pot. Not so with this one. Maybe it's the kid in us but we love to watch and listen to a percolator.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy D.

customer_reviews.title: If you like weak coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and makes decent coffee but the percolator termination switch goes bad after 4 month this time . The last one lasted 8 months. The very reason why I bought the Asurion insurance. Now having trouble getting them to step up a give me a replacement . Only $4 and thought I would give it a try. Will see.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Dog

customer_reviews.title: Produces weak "coffee" more like brown water
customer_reviews.text: I take back my positive review. Had 1 good cup of coffee the everything after was weak brown coffee water. I tried different coffee and filling the basket with grounds but it still made weak "coffee". I am returning and trying the "presto" brand, hope that turns out better.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Good HOT coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This pot makes really good HOT coffee. A much better brew than a drip coffeemaker. I don't have to use as much coffee to make the strength I like it and it brews pretty quickly. It's easy to take apart and wash. It reminds me of the coffee pot we had when I was growing up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee. This is my second one I purchased. First one I bought several years ago and just now stopped working. It lasted 4 years. Coffee is HOT when done perkalating.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Corrow

customer_reviews.title: great tasting cup of coffee made at home
customer_reviews.text: First time in a very long time I am enjoying a very hot, great tasting cup of coffee made at home. I love watching it percolate which starts immediately when plugged in. Easy to clean. Love the detachable power cord and locking top.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gail

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about a dozen uses, then sparked when ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a dozen uses, then sparked when I plugged it in. Indicator light quit working and pot emitted burning odor when I tried plugging it in again. Returned for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Javalove

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We use this pot to brew tea. We live in the south and my husband loves his sweet tea! I bought this one to replace one we’d had for years that “stopped working”. Actually, it wasn’t plugged in all the way so the old one is still going strong and the new one is on standby just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Thayel M. Caison

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Use it daily.
customer_reviews.text: So much better than cleaning reusable k-cups, which is what we used before. A tip, don't clean it with soap. It doesn't need it. Just hot water and you'll maintain the coffee flavor. Also watch your coffee grain size when grinding. The last cup always has grains, but we just strain it. No biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Megan G.

customer_reviews.title: Solved Mom's Bad Run with these
customer_reviews.text: My mother has had a couple different electric kettles, all of which always resulted in being held together with rubber bands and duct tape within months of her getting them. it's been a long while now since she's bought this one and it is still perking and going the way it did when it first showed up at her house.
customer_reviews.author: JKrue

customer_reviews.title: Not truly reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second one. The first one stopped working after a month. Received a replacement. That one worked for 2 months then started noticing a burning wire smell while the coffee was brewing and the machine would just short circuit and stop working. After a few minutes the light would come on green, BUT the coffee smelled like burned wires. And taste just as nasty.
customer_reviews.author: FabouC

customer_reviews.title: High quality percolator, makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made, quality appliance, and it quickly brews up a pot of great coffee. All components are stainless steel or glass, so no worries about contaminants or off-flavors. I use the old-fashioned disk filters in the basket so it's easy to dump the used grounds out, and there's very little "sludge," even using fine grind coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Brunnhilde

customer_reviews.title: Better than a drip coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Though I'm not a coffee drinker my husband loves it. The perculator gets hotter and stays hotter than any of the drip coffee makers we have had. Not any harder to set up and use than a drip, it takes less counter space than a drip maker. I love that I can take it to the table when we have company and don't have to keep getting up and down to serve hot coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this percolator!!!! We have been using it everyday for a month and no complaints. We even use regular ground coffee and put a throw away filter in the permanent filter so the ground coffee wouldn't get in the coffee. We buy off brand cheap coffee and this machine makes it taste much better than a regular coffee pot! Can't say anything bad about it!
customer_reviews.author: sweetncookies

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this in October - it died in January! The light stopped coming on and it no longer perked! I had to order another one. Wasn’t happy forking more money out for an appliance that does not hold up! It was for my son in law for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: K.G

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: After not so good tasting coffee and drip pots leaking, I went back to the old fashioned percolator. Awesome coffee. These Hamilton Beach percs have a permanent metal basket that is a filter. So no paper filters. It makes a perfect full bodied cup of coffee. Then goes to keep warm. The warmer doesn't darken or ruin the taste of the coffee even after left on all day. No pots to break.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Graulus

customer_reviews.title: Makes good hot coffee and keeps it hot for hours
customer_reviews.text: Even though I bought the lowest price model of this coffee pot it arrived in perfect condition.. brand new, no defects. Pleased with this purchase thank you. Dec Ist.. Need to update! The coffee pot stopped working yesterday.. it gets hot but doesn’t perk anymore! I’m very disappointed as it’s one day past it’s return date!!! Customer service can you help me?
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lost the perk
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a month fast perk, then stopped pushing water up to brew. Have contacted website for answers, phone lines down till middle of July due to COVID.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Henderson

customer_reviews.title: It's great, and so is the coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of drip coffee makers that take up so much counter space, so decided to try this. It's great, and so is the coffee. Just as fast as the drip variety. Most people will find more grounds in the coffee than they are accustomed to, so if this bothers you, try my trick. I put a second filter on top of the ground coffee. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Porter

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee at a great price. Tastes better than Keurig, Mr.Coffee type drips, and French press... just my opinion of course, but don't let the "old school" nature of perc'd coffee turn you away. I use very good beans (Kicking Horse 454) and put 2T in my little Starbucks grinder at a time. Two short pulses produce "coarse grind." I love the nostalgia of the percolator as well. The "warming" setting kept the coffee hot but not boiling.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kuni

customer_reviews.title: terrific coffee percolator
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these for work. We have a little coffee mess and these have held up the best. I have burnt out several other brands until I bought these. They are used and abused all day for ten hours at a shift. They continue to make great coffee. I clean them regularly but no more so than the last brands I had used. I have three at work and now one at home. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Jess F. Barajas

customer_reviews.title: Quick good coffee but a bit of a pain to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it perks the coffee quickly and just right. The bad thing is it is hard to set up the basket if you are using a paper filter in the basket. Also after using for just a week the light quite working.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best coffee pot I've ever owned. Makes the best tasting coffee, easy to use and clean, and doesn't take up a lot of counter space.
customer_reviews.author: LaMc

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee machine I’ve ever had. The coffee just tastes so much better. It takes just a bit longer to make coffee but it is worth it. I like being able to clean the parts thoroughly. Our last drip coffee maker had mold and buildup in the parts I couldn’t quite reach to clean. That was even after running coffee machine cleaner. The fact that I can clean this and make sure there isn’t any build up is what sold me.
customer_reviews.author: Merced Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Loved the design and the fact that takes up so ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the design and the fact that takes up so little space. It makes very good coffee although sometimes I get a residue in the bottom of my cup because I use a regular grind coffee. My main issue is that even after 2 months of use, instead of the aroma of coffee, there is a burnt smell—almost like an electrical or plastic burning.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Light doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The pot design is nice but after one month the light for being on quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best coffe Pot
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of this old fashioned pot. The fancy one cup, or the push button junk can't hold a light to this great pot. makes great coffee ever time. ( if you use a good coffee) Try it and be surprised with it.
customer_reviews.author: MOLLY S P

customer_reviews.title: I'm sorry the coffee just does not taste good and you have to put so much more in ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry the coffee just does not taste good and you have to put so much more in to get even a hint of coffee. I have been using percolators for 20 years and my antique store 1970s revereware percolator recently gave out. I have had bad luck with farberwares losing the ability to heat and so I thought I would try Hamilton Beach. I will keep it as a backup but I'm trying a Presto now. My parents have one and it makes good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Aeryn Sun

customer_reviews.title: Like coffee pot and it brews well but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Like coffee pot and it brews well but it is very noisy and the steam is crazy when perking. Have to make sure spout is facing away from open cabinets. But it does make a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B.
